004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.simulation;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.math.VecBuilder;
008import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N1;
009import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N2;
010import edu.wpi.first.math.system.LinearSystem;
011import edu.wpi.first.math.system.plant.DCMotor;
012import edu.wpi.first.math.system.plant.LinearSystemId;
013import edu.wpi.first.math.util.Units;
014import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotController;
015
016/** Represents a simulated DC motor mechanism. */
017public class DCMotorSim extends LinearSystemSim<N2, N1, N2> {
018  // Gearbox for the DC motor.
019  private final DCMotor m_gearbox;
020
021  // The gearing from the motors to the output.
022  private final double m_gearing;
023
024  /**
025   * Creates a simulated DC motor mechanism.
026   *
027   * @param plant The linear system representing the DC motor. This system can be created with
028   *     {@link edu.wpi.first.math.system.plant.LinearSystemId#createDCMotorSystem(DCMotor, double,
029   *     double)} or {@link
030   *     edu.wpi.first.math.system.plant.LinearSystemId#createDCMotorSystem(double, double)}. If
031   *     {@link edu.wpi.first.math.system.plant.LinearSystemId#createDCMotorSystem(double, double)}
032   *     is used, the distance unit must be radians.
033   * @param gearbox The type of and number of motors in the DC motor gearbox.
034   * @param gearing The gearing of the DC motor (numbers greater than 1 represent reductions).
035   * @param measurementStdDevs The standard deviations of the measurements. Can be omitted if no
036   *     noise is desired. If present must have 2 elements. The first element is for position. The
037   *     second element is for velocity.
038   */
039  public DCMotorSim(
040      LinearSystem<N2, N1, N2> plant,
041      DCMotor gearbox,
042      double gearing,
043      double... measurementStdDevs) {
044    super(plant, measurementStdDevs);
045    m_gearbox = gearbox;
046    m_gearing = gearing;
047  }
048
049  /**
050   * Creates a simulated DC motor mechanism.
051   *
052   * @param gearbox The type of and number of motors in the DC motor gearbox.
053   * @param gearing The gearing of the DC motor (numbers greater than 1 represent reductions).
054   * @param jKgMetersSquared The moment of inertia of the DC motor. If this is unknown, use the
055   *     {@link #DCMotorSim(LinearSystem, DCMotor, double, double...)} constructor.
056   * @param measurementStdDevs The standard deviations of the measurements. Can be omitted if no
057   *     noise is desired. If present must have 2 elements. The first element is for position. The
058   *     second element is for velocity.
059   */
060  public DCMotorSim(
061      DCMotor gearbox, double gearing, double jKgMetersSquared, double... measurementStdDevs) {
062    super(
063        LinearSystemId.createDCMotorSystem(gearbox, jKgMetersSquared, gearing), measurementStdDevs);
064    m_gearbox = gearbox;
065    m_gearing = gearing;
066  }
067
068  /**
069   * Sets the state of the DC motor.
070   *
071   * @param angularPositionRad The new position in radians.
072   * @param angularVelocityRadPerSec The new velocity in radians per second.
073   */
074  public void setState(double angularPositionRad, double angularVelocityRadPerSec) {
075    setState(VecBuilder.fill(angularPositionRad, angularVelocityRadPerSec));
076  }
077
078  /**
079   * Returns the DC motor position.
080   *
081   * @return The DC motor position.
082   */
083  public double getAngularPositionRad() {
084    return getOutput(0);
085  }
086
087  /**
088   * Returns the DC motor position in rotations.
089   *
090   * @return The DC motor position in rotations.
091   */
092  public double getAngularPositionRotations() {
093    return Units.radiansToRotations(getAngularPositionRad());
094  }
095
096  /**
097   * Returns the DC motor velocity.
098   *
099   * @return The DC motor velocity.
100   */
101  public double getAngularVelocityRadPerSec() {
102    return getOutput(1);
103  }
104
105  /**
106   * Returns the DC motor velocity in RPM.
107   *
108   * @return The DC motor velocity in RPM.
109   */
110  public double getAngularVelocityRPM() {
111    return Units.radiansPerSecondToRotationsPerMinute(getAngularVelocityRadPerSec());
112  }
113
114  /**
115   * Returns the DC motor current draw.
116   *
117   * @return The DC motor current draw.
118   */
119  public double getCurrentDrawAmps() {
120    // I = V / R - omega / (Kv * R)
121    // Reductions are output over input, so a reduction of 2:1 means the motor is spinning
122    // 2x faster than the output
123    return m_gearbox.getCurrent(m_x.get(1, 0) * m_gearing, m_u.get(0, 0))
124        * Math.signum(m_u.get(0, 0));
125  }
126
127  /**
128   * Sets the input voltage for the DC motor.
129   *
130   * @param volts The input voltage.
131   */
132  public void setInputVoltage(double volts) {
133    setInput(volts);
134    clampInput(RobotController.getBatteryVoltage());
135  }
136}
